required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fast Tracking Impact on Fentanyl Consumption and Parents Satisfaction
clinical_study.official_title: Fast Tracking Impact on Fentanyl Consumption and Parents Satisfaction in Non Complex Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are measuring fentanyl consumption in micrograms used during anesthesia for patients on fast track congenital cardiac surgeries

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators are measuring fentanyl consumed for both fast track and conventional corrective cardiac surgeries and also parents Parental Perceptions satisfaction with early child communication in ICU and impact of caudal anesthesia on extubation time our 2ry outcomes are the hospital and ICU length of stay

primary_outcome.description: amount of fentanyl used in microgram

primary_outcome.time_frame: after discharge from the ICU up to 1 week
primary_outcome.description: questionnare for parents satisfaction by early child communication

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after departure from operation room until ward discharge up to 3 weeks
from admission until home discharge up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: total number of days spent in hospital

arm_group.description: the patients extubated in O.R or within 2 hours in the ICU
the patients extubated after 2 hours from O.R

intervention.description: amount of fentanyl used in both groups

study_pop.textblock: patients diagnosed with congenital cardiac anomaly for surgical correction from 3months to 18 years of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients diagnosed with congenital cardiac anomaly for surgical correction.
- age limit: child 3months of age to 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
patients with any o the following:
- emergency surgeries
- redo surgeries
- complex surgeries
- patients weight less than 3kg

responsible_party.investigator_title: lecturer of anesthesia and intensive care and pain management

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD Will be shared upon request
